website_summaries.verdict: A heavy-duty post hole digger that can tackle the toughest jobs, if you have the muscle power to make it happen.
pros: Shaped fiberglass handles mean no more clashing knuckles
Beveled steel carbon head with pointed blades facilitate deep soil penetration so you can scoop up large loads
cons: To get the maximum benefit from this tool, you need to be rather strong because it is heavy

customer_reviews.title: Great tool and better than most at digging holes.
customer_reviews.text: Arrived in one piece which was I'm sure super annoying to the postal service but much appreciated on my end. I've used many different post hole diggers but I really like this one. It seems easier to use and more efficient at removal of dirt than most. The only issue I have is there are several nuts/bolts that want to loosen which gives an awkward feel and less driving force during digging. It is typically the center nut and bolt that connects the two handles. When this occurs I simply re-tighten but might look at some locking nuts. Overall it works as advertised and I'd say better than most.
customer_reviews.author: Kristi Lay

customer_reviews.title: Medium Duty, not Heavy Duty - Nice design, OK Value!
customer_reviews.text: "Medium Duty" Nice design. The handle movement is (better) opposite of older design so that you push together to close and remove dirt. And you do not bang your knuckles together. But, not Heavy Duty, so after about 40 "hard holes" in rock and root area the hinge point is worn out. I would have paid more for Heavy Duty Model but could not find one quickly on Amazon. OK value for the cost, so even though it is worn out, I am not returning it (because of the hard use).
customer_reviews.author: NJ Person

customer_reviews.title: Took 10 years of abuse
customer_reviews.text: I have had this same exact kind of post hole diggers for 10 years. they are heavy, but it helps dig the hole faster. I use them daily for work. I just purchased a second set because my 10 year old set finally broke beyond repair. For a tool that takes a beating, these last a long time. worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: 3rd nut

customer_reviews.title: Just purchase another wood handle digger
customer_reviews.text: Extremely heavy tool. Add the weight of the dirt it picks up and you really miss your lighter (albeit less durable) wooden handle post digger. A clean hole had yet to be dug with this beast as you really have little control due to the weight and exaggerated swing. I will gladly repurchase a worn out $25 digger every year for three years to not have to use this guy again. Live and learn.
customer_reviews.author: MTNHIKR

customer_reviews.title: Little heavy but runs like clockwork
customer_reviews.text: I own a fence company and we run a few different slap sticks and these are up there. Long blades make for less scoops but the weight is a little unwieldy. Love the hooks on top for deep holes. The kobalt ones at lowes combined with these would be the perfect digs. Love the plastic top handles too, better than fiberglass.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product, but it does take a man to ...
customer_reviews.text: Well constructed and goes to a greater depth than any other on the market, by that I mean you can actually get the dirt out of the bottom of the hole. Great product, but it does take a man to operate.
customer_reviews.author: Laney M Pankey

customer_reviews.title: I'm diggin a hole.
customer_reviews.text: Sure enough, it does what it says. It digs holes. I dug just seven 2-foot holes for T-posts, and this thing did a great job. Would a normal, cheaper digger have been fine? Yeah. But it would have taken longer in my hard clay soil. I'm happy with the ergonomics of this thing, and the weight of it as well.
customer_reviews.author: A. Goldberg

customer_reviews.title: Heavy and efficient digger!
customer_reviews.text: This is not a light hold digger by any means, but that also adds to it's ability to make a hole fast and deep. I was making 3 foot holes in mostly sandy soil in less than 10 grabs.. really nice.
customer_reviews.author: A. Natale

customer_reviews.title: Heavy post hole diggers that reach deep for a 6 ...
customer_reviews.text: Heavy post hole diggers that reach deep for a 6 inch hole. I was able to dig 3’ deep 6” holes, and 4’ deep 8” holes. The extra weight really helped when digging the last foot through solid clay. Much easier to use than the standard post hole diggers I was using, and I was able to dig much deeper narrow holes for fence posts.
customer_reviews.author: Szilla

customer_reviews.title: Prob to heavy for a homeowner but they suck for everyday use
customer_reviews.text: Bolts broke in two weeks - handles snapped off the one pair I bought. I paid $70 for them but spend the extra $20 and get the razor backs. Can’t return them now bc it’s been a month and a half...waste. Prob a crap warranty too
customer_reviews.author: BDFence

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding
customer_reviews.text: The best post hole digger I've ever used. I've only used three but this almost makes me want to dig more holes.
customer_reviews.author: Roger Carlsen

customer_reviews.title: Best Manual Post Hole Digger Ever
customer_reviews.text: The weight and design of this post hole digger make the normally difficult task of digging post holes easy. Throw away all of your big box store post hole diggers.
customer_reviews.author: G. Oleson

customer_reviews.title: Works well in rocky soil
customer_reviews.text: Husband says it has great grip the way it is made, and clamped down well on rocks in the ground. We live in the mountains and the soil is extremely rocky shale. This tool helped a lot with post holes for our fence.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy on the arms
customer_reviews.text: I have been using a power auger for years. Since moving to florida the soil is all sand. I like to use these diggers for small jobs. They are extremely easy on the arms.
customer_reviews.author: Mickey C

customer_reviews.title: Task built for sure
customer_reviews.text: Okay, this was made to dig holes in hard soil, what a beast. And a great workout just hefting it, but in this case weight is a good thing.
customer_reviews.author: HFL

customer_reviews.title: does the job
customer_reviews.text: Made well. Husband hated it, much heavier than the traditional one we have. But it does dig the hold a little faster, just uses more muscle
customer_reviews.author: Ckwood

customer_reviews.title: Great concept
customer_reviews.text: I use these for installing fence, they work well and I really like the handles. The only down fall is they are a lot heavier than the normal post hole digger.
customer_reviews.author: stacey

customer_reviews.title: Jackson Dig EZ Post Hole Digger
customer_reviews.text: Well built and does not pinch hands. Heavy, and will give you a good workout I used this and a Ames Digger and Tamper Bar to dig a hole in very hard soil to plant a tree. Best Post hole digger I have owned.
customer_reviews.author: Tech53

customer_reviews.title: Amazing advance over traditional style
customer_reviews.text: This is the best post hole design I have ever used. Far better than the standard straight handle types. It digs much deeper holes without constantly banging your knuckles together. I have no idea why anyone still uses the other style. These are more fragile with more moving parts so don't twist and beat on them.
customer_reviews.author: KB

customer_reviews.title: A tool that will last a lifetime....
customer_reviews.text: A tool that will last a lifetime.... Not much more than a wooden handled digger, and more comfortable. Only thing better is either a gas auger, or having some one else dig the holes!
customer_reviews.author: WILLIAM D.

customer_reviews.title: Diggin it...
customer_reviews.text: Works awesome. Easy to get down to the 24 to 36" range. didn't find it any heavier than my other heave duty one. Seems to be a better quality than the one the local hardware store carries too.
customer_reviews.author: Islanders

customer_reviews.title: Weighs a ton, gets the job done!
customer_reviews.text: Works great, but you get a work out when using it. This thing is heavy! Gets a nice big scoop with each attack. The no crush your fingers design is very nice indeed.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Not a knuckle buster...
customer_reviews.text: After having purchased 4 Post Hole Diggers, this is the one that I have grown to like. It has good weight, well made and intelligently designed. One is enabled to dig deep holes and extract dirt. This is due to the design of the unit. It was like finding a better mouse trap! You will like this product. I would recommend it without hesitation.
customer_reviews.author: David N. Bergeron

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Awesome!! guaranteed to keep employees from stealing my gas auger again!!
customer_reviews.author: Brad Kuhn

customer_reviews.title: BEST DESIGN EVER!!!
customer_reviews.text: Oh my these things are nice! Why all post hole diggers dont have this design is beyond me.
customer_reviews.author: Mp

customer_reviews.title: Will make good boat anchor when it is worn out
customer_reviews.text: Heavier duty than Fiskars unit it replaced but not as agile. Will make good boat anchor when it is worn out.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Howell

customer_reviews.title: Premium quality tool!
customer_reviews.text: I love the tool but if your digging 8in. diameter footings beyond 4ft. you will need to use something else. Anything else this is your tool!!!
customer_reviews.author: Dan Berry

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Very satisfied with this product works real good digging holes 3 ft or deeper easy to handle too
customer_reviews.author: E. Aguilar

customer_reviews.title: Great Post Hole Digger
customer_reviews.text: We had to dig about 8 holes that were 2-3' deep in really rocky soil. This, combined with a 6' steel bar, did the job perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Jay H.

customer_reviews.title: Did a nice job, but you definitely need muscles to wield ...
customer_reviews.text: Huge! Did a nice job, but you definitely need muscles to wield this!
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: My ranch hand is enthusiastic about his new post hole digger.
customer_reviews.text: He is impressed with how this post hole digger works, the blades, the innovative design and the grips. He is hard on a post hole digger but I think this one will last for a while.
customer_reviews.author: Mac

customer_reviews.title: Killer
customer_reviews.text: If you have to dig post holes this is it
customer_reviews.author: Gene G

customer_reviews.title: Excellent pair of post hole diggers
customer_reviews.text: Excellent pair of post hole diggers. Exceptionally well designed and extra heavy duty. Probably the last pair I will ever have to purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Heavy and the texture on the hand pads can really cause some blisters.
customer_reviews.author: rebler

customer_reviews.title: Very appreciated gift!
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for our future son-in-law. He needed them for his job as a construction worker. His coworkers are jealous as they get bruised knuckles with their own post hole diggers that are not ergonomically designed.
customer_reviews.author: Kalani

customer_reviews.title: Finally a decent mprovement on an archaic tool!
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical about this digger. But for the price I was willing to try it out. This thing is significantly better than traditional units. The old style is archaic and extremely laborious to use. They're fine for a shallow hole (1 to 2' or so). Not that this one makes digging a hole easy, but it sure makes it easier, especially for digging deeper than a couple feet. The pivoting action is key as it provides a leveraged mechanical advantage, allowing tighter jaw closure but also with less effort. But my favorite feature is the overmolded rubber grips that also prevent your hands from slamming together when closing.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Best hand diggers on the market. Heavier than standard diggers.
customer_reviews.author: John in Ohio

customer_reviews.title: Built like a tank
customer_reviews.text: The only thing that could possibly make this a better tool would be if someone else were digging the holes for me.
customer_reviews.author: Holo

customer_reviews.title: it bites!
customer_reviews.text: Performs as advertised... although sometimes it's easier if you start your posthole with a shovel (especially through sod) then move to the digger, using the spear chucker method... this baby is heavy so the weight works best that way... lifting it out of the hole can be a little bit more exercise, but it seems to be pretty effective at holding the dirt. I was concerned about getting too tired out but since I only had a couple of holes to dig I don't really know about that. A bigger person wouldn't worry about it. It's much easier to make a deeper more narrow hole than a regular digger can. Pretty cool altogether!
customer_reviews.author: Primeval

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Product works great, easy to use, makes getting the dirt out of the hole fast.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I finally can dig a hole without having to wrap ...
customer_reviews.text: I finally can dig a hole without having to wrap the arms of the digger around my waist to pull the dirt out of the hole!
customer_reviews.author: Paula

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Only post hole digger I will buy from now on
customer_reviews.author: CPO

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Best post hole digger made, this thing works better than my power auger.
customer_reviews.author: Mark E

customer_reviews.title: Get rid of your old digger and buy the Jackson digger now!
customer_reviews.text: Throw or give away those light weight wooden handled knuckle busters! I'm putting some vinyl fencing around my home. I live in Georgia and I'm digging in our famous red clay. I prepped the hole with a digging bar and and a water hose. Used the Jackson digger the next morning after taking a whack at the prepped hole with my old post hole digger. This post hole is much heftier which really helps. The bent handles give much better leverage and the design keeps your hands from banging together. I won't ever need to replace this tool!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I used this tools to dig 14 - 2 foot ...
customer_reviews.text: I used this tools to dig 14 - 2 foot holes. It is a bit heavy, and wished they could have made the steel in those areas that will impact the soil heavier. All and all it has worked as designed.
customer_reviews.author: AZ Scott

customer_reviews.title: It's a big un
customer_reviews.text: As reviewed, this digger is strong. It makes hole digging fun. It has enough heft to sink into clay with each chop then, the fortitude to not bend when wrenched laterally. I trimmed out 21 12" holes after my PTO auger made the 8" holes. My contractor poured the piers. His digger looked meek, mild, and bendable compared to the Ames. I'm pretty such he should just toss his.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Scott

customer_reviews.title: Works great!!
customer_reviews.text: Works great!!! I would definitely recommend this post hole digger. Its heavy, which I like, to help drive the shovel downward but heavy coming back up. It worked very well for me.
customer_reviews.author: William G Archambault

customer_reviews.title: Better than any other!
customer_reviews.text: It isn't too often I actually get a tool (I'm a real tool guy) that exceeds expectations. This post hole digger was one of them. It's still hard work, digging post holes, but using this tool made it enjoyable - gasp! Gauged hole top to bottom and minimizes how much cement you need to set the posts.
customer_reviews.author: M. K.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tool. Works well for post holes or setting ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent tool. Works well for post holes or setting trees & shrubs, etc.Hinge design allows for digging deeper holes without enlarging diameter.
customer_reviews.author: Roger A. O'Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Not an improvement
customer_reviews.text: As good as a regular post hole digger at only twice the price
customer_reviews.author: Raynphx

product_meta.title: Jackson 1715100 Dig EZ Post Hole Digger
product_meta.description:
The Jackson dig EZ post hole digger features an innovative design with shaped fiberglass handles to protect knuckle collision. The tempered blades are pointed for maximum penetration with less effort. The travel distance is an ergonomically friendly 40% less than that of standard post hole diggers. The fiberglass handle provides ultimate core strength and durability. The beveled steel carbon head has a 6.21-inch spread, perfect for digging post holes for mailboxes, fences, and flowers.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Jackson Dig EZ industrial post hole digger. The Innovative handle design eliminates knuckle collision.
feature_bullets: Beveled steel carbon head has a 6.21-Inch spread
Innovative handle design with shaped fiberglass handles
Pointed, tempered blades for maximum soil penetration

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars90 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
